author: Irshad
title: Arunachal signs MoU with Dubai company for export of fruits, vegetables | Pro IQRA News – PRO IQRA NEWS
text: News Updates. Itanagar: To promote exports of agricultural and allied products from Arunachal Pradesh, the state Agriculture Marketing Board (APAMB) has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Dubai-based Lulu Hypermarket. The MoU was signed in New Delhi on Friday on the sidelines of the World Food India 2023 event, officials said here on Saturday. Chief Minister Pema Khandu expressed her happiness over the agreement. Taking to X, Khandu said, “Happy to share that Arunachal Pradesh Agriculture Marketing Board (APAMB) has signed a five-year MoU with Lulu Hypermarket LLC, Dubai, UAE, for supply of oranges and vegetables to Gulf countries.” This agreement paves the way for the supply of oranges and vegetables to the Gulf countries, marking an important milestone in agriculture and market connectivity. The MoU shall provide opportunities for our farmers to further expand their market presence at the global level and also make agriculture more lucrative for them, the Chief Minister said. “I wish all those involved in this landmark agreement my best wishes,” he added. The MoU, which is for five years, primarily covers the export of orange, pumpkin and some other products from the state to the Gulf countries through the extensive network of Lulu Hypermarkets, one of the leading and diversified business conglomerates with more than 200 supermarkets across the country. the world and a turnover of 8.5 billion USD. The MoU was signed by APAMB CEO Okit Paling and the company’s CMD Zulfikar Kadavath. The collaboration will open new avenues for the agricultural community, creating opportunities for farmers and producers to expand their reach and showcase their products on a global scale, the officials said. Lulu Hypermarkets will work closely with APAMB to facilitate the export of a wide range of agricultural and allied products from the state. The collaboration aims to promote economic growth, increase exports and improve the overall well-being of farmers. APAMB is also in active discussion with Singapore based exporters and plans to take advantage of the cargo flight from Guwahati to Singapore .
